name: Advanced - Risk Management & Precision
description: Advanced concepts including invalidation, risk management, and session characteristics

rules.title: Order Block Invalidation
rules.rule_text: An order block becomes invalid when price closes below a bullish order block or above a bearish order block. Exit trades immediately upon invalidation.
validation_questions: When is an order block invalidated?
What should you do upon invalidation?
examples: Bullish OB at 1.1200 - close below = invalid, exit long
Bearish OB at 1.2800 - close above = invalid, exit short

rules.title: Position Size Management
rules.rule_text: Risk only 1-2% of account per trade. Position size must be calculated based on stop loss distance, not arbitrary lot sizes.
validation_questions: What percentage should you risk per trade?
How do you calculate position size?
Why not use arbitrary lot sizes?
examples: $10k account, 2% risk = $200 max loss per trade
50 pip stop = 0.4 lots on EURUSD for $200 risk

rules.title: London Session Trading
rules.rule_text: London session often creates the daily range. Look for initial displacement and potential reversals during this session.
validation_questions: What should you look for in London?
examples: London open creates 100 pip range on GBPUSD
Initial selloff then reversal during London session
